intro: Dasystachys gracilis, commonly known as the slender spikerush, is a herbaceous plant native to the wetlands and marshes of eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other similar grass-like plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of pale yellow to brown flowers. It typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, often forming dense stands in its habitat. Dasystachys gracilis plays an important role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
